title: [question] compile a source for mips
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
`
go version go1.2.1 linux/amd64`

2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?

```
GOARCH="amd64"
GOBIN=""
GOCHAR="6"
GOEXE=""
GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
GOHOSTOS="linux"
GOOS="linux"
GOPATH=""
GORACE=""
GOROOT="/usr/lib/go"
GOTOOLDIR="/usr/lib/go/pkg/tool/linux_amd64"
TERM="dumb"
CC="gcc"
GOGCCFLAGS="-g -O2 -fPIC -m64 -pthread"
CXX="g++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"
```

3. What did you do?
If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error.
A complete runnable program is good.
A link on play.golang.org is best.


4. What did you expect to see?


5. What did you see instead?

-------

Hi!

I have a mipsel router (mips32) with TomatoUSB and I have a 4g dongle, which uses hi-link. And I found [this](https://github.com/knq/hilink) source, So I want to compile it using cross-compiler on my ubuntu PC.

But when I try to get it, it says:

```
# env GOOS=linux GOARCH=mips go get https://github.com/knq/hilink
2016/06/29 16:59:45 unsupported GOARCH mips
```

So how Can I compile it?

Thanks!
